In a specific situation list of attributes could be empty for every candidate. I would prefer to do two things here:
1] create a private method for the whole logic of preparing those attributes
2] use either some boolean variable with info that this step was already made or also check the emptiness of candidate's list of attributes

timeline.message:
Change of transaction over synchronizeGroup

- synchronizeGroup does not run in separate transaction anymore
- methods used in synchronizeGroup that updated, removed, and added members from external source now accept as parameter only one member at a time and all three methods run in separate transaction
- refactored code of processing methods, especially solved and removed two occurrences of FIXME
- changed order of submethods to remove, update, add so the group is smaller for update and add methods
- also added tests of synchronizeGroup

Refactor processing methods of synchronizeGroup

- methods updateExistingMemberWhileSynchronization and removeFormerMemberWhileSynchronization were separated into smaller chunks of private methods

Fixes based on review

- updated some comments
- check of authoritative group moved outside of cycle of members in removeFormerMemberWhileSynchronization
- updating member and user attributes works with attribute definitions in updateExistingMemberWhileSynchronization
- updating userExtSources moved to private method for better readability in updateExistingMemberWhileSynchronization

Fixes based on review

- added check for null attributes of candidate in getAttributesToSynchronizeFromCandidates

Fixes based on review

- added check for null attributes of candidate in getAttributesToSynchronizeFromCandidates
